main.name: I'm Nikita Voevodin
main.description: A professional data engineer and full-stack developer with current concentration in native app developement. Hacking away at the NYC Taxi & Limousine Commission. P.S: If you are interested in learning R, check out my book R, Not the Best Practices (link below).
main.bio: I am a professional data engineer and full-stack developer with current concentration in native app developement. Currently, I am a senior data analyst at the NYC Taxi & Limousine Commission. My work involves developing and automating big data processes, building and interacting with databases, creating apps and dashboards for TLC and public, as well as conducting high level research to support impactful legislation in the area of city transportation. I am also a creator of VolleyPal - a social network app for volleyball players (More info at www.volleypal.site).
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: This is my modest evaluation of my own core programming skills.

education.school: Colin Powell School for Civic and Global Leadership (CUNY)
Colin Powell School for Civic and Global Leadership (CUNY)

work.title: Senior Data Analyst
work.description: Script Python, R and SQL queries for data exploration, data validation and ETL procedures. Design, build, and interact with SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, ClickHouse databases, as well as aggregated warehousing solutions to produce independently requested metrics for senior leadership. Provide complete support and maintain TLC Data Hub and other apps. Research, prototype, and present new ideas to advance the agencyâ€™s mission and streamline internal operations. Serve as a liaison for transferring data from TLC to the Mayors Office, other city agencies, as well as media outlets like NYT, WSJ, and New York Post.

work.title: Data Analyst
work.description: Created a variety of apps and dashboards with designed and implemented backend database setups for both TLC and public consumption (eg., DataHub, VinDecoder, MeetUp App). Conducted advanced data analyses to assist agency initiatives, such as the Congestion Study and TLC Vehicle Cap. Instituted a bi-weekly data meetup that connected analysts across multiple departments to engage and develop new products.

work.title: Data Analyst
work.description: Introduced SQL and Excel into the daily operation of the 72nd district office, which helped automate and streamline most of the data tasks. Successfully distributed $4 million of NYS capital funding and $500,000 of discretional funding to the municipal and non-profit organizations of the 72 Assembly district. Increased submission of legislation proposals by recruiting and supervising a team of interns.
